00049 /**
00050  *  Verbose
00051  * @brief Class for doing logging and some command line ui.
00052  */
00053 class APTLIB_API Verbose {
00054 
00055 public:
00056   /**
00057    *  Utility class for remembering our parameters of interest.
00058    */
00059   class Param {
00060 
00061   public: 
00062     Param(ProgressHandler *progHandler, MsgHandler *msgHandler, MsgHandler *warnHandler) {
00063       m_Verbosity = 1;
00064       m_NewLine = true;
00065       m_Output = true;
00066       m_ProHandler.push_back(progHandler);
00067       m_MsgHandler.push_back(msgHandler);
00068       m_WarnHandler.push_back(warnHandler);
00069       m_ProgDefault = progHandler;
00070       m_MsgDefault = msgHandler;
00071       m_WarnDefault = warnHandler;
00072     }
00073 
00074     ProgressHandler *m_ProgDefault;
00075     MsgHandler *m_MsgDefault;
00076     MsgHandler *m_WarnDefault;
00077     std::vector<ProgressHandler *> m_ProHandler; ///< Vector of handlers to be called with progress reports.
00078     std::vector<MsgHandler *> m_MsgHandler; ///< Vector of handlers for messages (i.e. log files, consoles, dialogs).
00079     std::vector<MsgHandler *> m_WarnHandler; ///< Vector of handlers for warnings
00080     bool m_NewLine;   ///< Was a new line outputted after last message?
00081     bool m_Output;    ///< Do we report messages
00082     int m_Verbosity;  ///< What level of messages is wanted, larger num == more msgs
00083     std::vector<int> m_DotMod;     ///< How often do we print a dot when dot() is called?
00084     std::vector<int> m_DotCount;   ///< How many times has dot() been called?
00085   };
00086   
00087   /** 
00088    * @brief This function gets around the problem of static variable
00089    * initialization as local static variables work more consistently.
00090    * @return Param - Our static parameters for this class.
00091    */
00092   static Param &getParam();
00093   
00094   /// @brief Functions to add and remove handlers for communcation functions.
00095   static void pushProgressHandler(ProgressHandler *handler);
00096   static void popProgressHandler();
00097   static void removeProgressHandler(ProgressHandler *h);
00098   static void removeProgressHandler(std::vector<ProgressHandler *> &vec, ProgressHandler *h);
00099 
00100   static void pushMsgHandler(MsgHandler *handler);
00101   static void popMsgHandler();
00102   static void removeMsgHandler(MsgHandler *handler);
00103   static void removeMsgHandler(std::vector<MsgHandler *> &vec, MsgHandler *h);
00104 
00105   static void pushWarnHandler(MsgHandler *handler);
00106   static void popWarnHandler();
00107 
00108   static void progressBegin(int verbosity, const std::string &msg, int total, int dotMod, int maxCalls);
00109   static void progressStep(int verbosity);
00110   static void progressEnd(int verbosity, const std::string &msg);
00111 
00112   static void removeDefault();
00113 
00114   /** 
00115    * @brief Set whether or not output messages are logged
00116    *        useful to turn off output when catching expected errors
00117    *
00118    * @param output - true or false
00119    */  
00120   static void setOutput(bool output);
00121 
00122   /** 
00123    * @brief Set the level of verbosity desired. 0 == no messages
00124    * 1 == normal messages, 2,3,4, etc. == more verbose.
00125    * @param level - level of verbosity desired.
00126    */  
00127   static void setLevel(int level);
00128 
00129   /** 
00130    * @brief Print a message to the stream.
00131    * @param level - What level of verbosity this message should be printed at.
00132    * @param s - Message to be printed.
00133    * @param nl - Should a newline be appended to message?
00134    */
00135   static void out(int level, const std::string &s, bool nl = true);
00136 
00137   /** 
00138    * @brief Print a warning message.
00139    * @param level - What level of verbosity this message should be printed at.
00140    * @param s - Message to be printed.
00141    * @param nl - Should a newline be appended to message?
00142    */
00143   static void warn(int level, const std::string &s, bool nl = true, const std::string prefix = "\nWARNING: ");
00144 
00145 };

00147 #endif /* _VERBOSE_H */
